com.ibm.mqlight.api.impl

Class LogbackLogging

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.mqlight.api.impl.LogbackLogging

  • public class LogbackLogging
extends Object
    Sets up logging using logback, when it is available.

    This class is a simple wrapper to LogbackLoggingImpl such that the program can function when logback is not available on the classpath (as LogbackLoggingImpl will only be loaded if we have determined that logback is available).

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogbackLogging

        public LogbackLogging()

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public static void setup()
        Sets up logging. Can be called multiple times with no side-effect on all but the first invocation. Should be invoked from any class that an application writer might invoke (e.g. the client and any pluggable components) ahead of any calls to the SLF4J logging framework (e.g. a static constructor would be a good place).

        This method only attempts to setup Logback-based logging if all of the following conditions are met:

        1. Logback is available on the classpath.
        2. Logback is being used as the implementation of SLF4J.
        3. Logback is not already started.
        The intent is to integrate with applications that have already configured SLF4J based on their own preferences, while still supporting a logging capability if the client is used in an environment where no prior SLF4-based logging has been configured.

      • stop

        public static void stop()
        Stops the logging.
